Description: Rim sherd of Chian pottery Type B1 kantharos; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; part of lotus flower in added white outline with added red centres; exterior reserved; inscription on exterior.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Temple of Aphrodite (Naukratis), Context Φ5
Curator's comments: The sherd joins British Museum 1924,1201.803. See Bailey, D. 'Some Fresh Naukratis Joins', The Annual of the British School at Athens 63, 1970, 3-4. Many kantharoi Type B (See Williams, D. ‘Aigina, Aphaia-Tempel 5. The pottery from Chios’, Archäologischer Anzeiger 1983, 169) have painted inscriptions beneath the rim; several have been found on Aegina as well as at Naukratis. ɸ5 (?) is written in pencil on the interior surfsce of the sherd.
Bibliographic references: Cook & Woodhead 1952 / Painted Inscriptions on Chiot Pottery (p. 168, no. 118)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 725, no. 843)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1767) (phase 2)
